Package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx

Class SColorFactory

java.lang.Object
squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx.SColorFactory
public class SColorFactory
extends Object
Provides utilities for working with colors as well as caching operations for color creation. All returned SColor objects are cached so multiple requests for the same SColor will not create duplicate long term objects.
Author:
Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com, Tommy Ettinger - responsible for mutilating this class to work on libGDX
See Also:
another technique for caching colors that allows filters.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description

    Constructs a new SColorFactory with an empty cache.

  • Constructor Details

    • SColorFactory

      public SColorFactory()
      Constructs a new SColorFactory with an empty cache.
      Implementation note: SColorFactory initially used static methods and was not intended to be constructed by users, but for compatibility with Android (where static instances may linger into another run of an application), it was reworked to require an object to be constructed and for that object to contain the cache, rather than a static instance. Code written for earlier versions of SquidLib may use static methods on SColorFactory; most code written in SquidLib 3.0.0 beta 2 and newer prefers the IColorCenter implementations such as SquidColorCenter when SColor features such as color names aren't required. Since beta 4, SquidColorCenter implements most of SColorFactory's API, and also supports an IFilter for automatic changes to requested colors.

  • Method Details

    • colorForValue

      public SColor colorForValue​(int argb)
      Returns the SColor whose value matches the one passed in. If no SColor constant matches that value, then a cached or new SColor is returned that matches the provided value. This method constructs a list of the SColor constants the first time it is called.
      Parameters:
      argb - an int encoding 256 * 256 * 256 * alpha + 256 * 256 * red + 256 * green + blue
      Returns:
      the SColor with value argb

    • quantityCached

      public int quantityCached()
      Returns the number of SColor objects currently cached.
      Returns:

    • blend

      public SColor blend​(SColor color1, SColor color2, double coef)
      Returns an SColor that is the given distance from the first color to the second color.
      Parameters:
      color1 - The first color
      color2 - The second color
      coef - The percent towards the second color, as 0.0 to 1.0
      Returns:

    • randomBlend

      public SColor randomBlend​(SColor color1, SColor color2, double min, double max)
      Returns an SColor that is randomly chosen from the color line between the two provided colors from the two provided points.
      Parameters:
      color1 -
      color2 -
      min - The minimum percent towards the second color, as 0.0 to 1.0
      max - The maximum percent towards the second color, as 0.0 to 1.0
      Returns:

    • add

      public SColor add​(SColor color1, SColor color2)
      Adds the two colors together.
      Parameters:
      color1 -
      color2 -
      Returns:

    • lightWith

      public SColor lightWith​(SColor color, SColor light)
      Uses the second color as a light source, meaning that each of the red, green, and blue values of the first color are multiplied by the lighting color's percentage of full value (1.0).
      Parameters:
      color -
      light -
      Returns:

    • emptyCache

      public void emptyCache()
      Clears the backing cache. Should only be used if an extreme number of colors are being created and then not reused, such as when blending different colors in different areas that will not be revisited.

    • setFloor

      public void setFloor​(int value)
      Sets the value at which each of the red, green, and blue values will be set to the nearest lower multiple of. For example, a floor value of 5 would mean that each of those values would be considered the nearest lower multiple of 5 when building the colors. If the value passed in is less than 1, then the flooring value is set at 1.
      Parameters:
      value - used to determine the precision of rounding

    • getFloor

      public long getFloor()
      Gets the value at which each of the red, green, and blue values will be set to the nearest lower multiple of.
      For example, a floor value of 5 would mean that each of those values would be considered the nearest lower multiple of 5 when building the colors.
      Returns:
      the current floor value as a long, which defaults to 1.

    • asSColor

      public SColor asSColor​(int argb)
      Returns the cached color that matches the desired rgb value. If the color is not already in the cache, it is created and added to the cache. This method does not check to see if the value is already available as a SColor constant. If such functionality is desired then please use colorForValue(int rgb) instead.
      Parameters:
      argb -
      Returns:

    • asSColor

      public SColor asSColor​(float a, float r, float g, float b)
      Returns the cached color that matches the desired rgb value. If the color is not already in the cache, it is created and added to the cache. This method does not check to see if the value is already available as a SColor constant. If such functionality is desired then please use colorForValue(int rgb) instead.
      Parameters:
      a - alpha, between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive
      r - red, between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive
      g - green, between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive
      b - blue, between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive
      Returns:
      an SColor with an unspecified name and the given a, r, g, and b values

    • asSColor

      public SColor asSColor​(int r, int g, int b)
      Returns an SColor that is opaque.
      Parameters:
      r - red, between 0 and 255 inclusive
      g - green, between 0 and 255 inclusive
      b - blue, between 0 and 255 inclusive
      Returns:
      an SColor with an unspecified name, full (opaque) alpha, and the given r, g, and b values

    • asSColor

      public SColor asSColor​(int a, int r, int g, int b)
      Returns an SColor with the given values, with those values clamped between 0 and 255.
      Parameters:
      a - alpha, between 0 and 255 inclusive
      r - red, between 0 and 255 inclusive
      g - green, between 0 and 255 inclusive
      b - blue, between 0 and 255 inclusive
      Returns:
      an SColor with an unspecified name and the given a, r, g, and b values

    • asSColor

      public SColor asSColor​(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color color)
      Returns an SColor representation of the provided Color. If there is a named SColor constant that matches the value, then that constant is returned.
      Parameters:
      color -
      Returns:

    • desaturate

      public SColor desaturate​(SColor color, double percent)
      Returns an SColor that is the version of the provided color desaturated the given amount.
      Parameters:
      color -
      percent - The percent to desaturate, from 0.0 for none to 1.0 for fully desaturated
      Returns:

    • asGradient

      public ArrayList<SColor> asGradient​(SColor color1, SColor color2)
      Returns a list of colors starting at the first color and moving to the second color. The end point colors are included in the list.
      Parameters:
      color1 - starting color
      color2 - ending color
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of SColor going from color1 to color2; the length should be no greater than 256.

    • palette

      public ArrayList<SColor> palette​(String name)
      Returns the palette associate with the provided name, or null if there is no such palette.
      Parameters:
      name -
      Returns:

    • pallet

      public ArrayList<SColor> pallet​(String name)
      Deprecated.
      Prefer palette over this misspelled version.
      Returns the palette associate with the provided name, or null if there is no such palette.
      Parameters:
      name -
      Returns:

    • fromPalette

      public SColor fromPalette​(String name, float percent)
      Returns the SColor that is the provided percent towards the end of the palette. Bounds are checked so as long as there is at least one color in the palette, values below 0 will return the first element and values above 1 will return the last element; If there is no palette keyed to the provided name, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      name -
      percent -
      Returns:

    • fromPallet

      public SColor fromPallet​(String name, float percent)
      Deprecated.
      Prefer fromPalette over this misspelled version; they are equivalent.
      Returns the SColor that is the provided percent towards the end of the palette. Bounds are checked so as long as there is at least one color in the palette, values below 0 will return the first element and values above 1 will return the last element; If there is no palette keyed to the provided name, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      name -
      percent -
      Returns:
